message:
A tree is known by it’s fruit and IIT Kharagpur is no different. It has always been driven and motivated by the achievements of it’s esteemed alumni and their accomplishments are the crowning glory of the Institute. Climbing the ladder to success at an exemplary pace, young alumni achievers are the greatest inspiration for all those who aspire to be great. IIT Kharagpur would like to take this opportunity to acknowledge and reward distinguished young graduates who have contributed significantly to their companies and communities while upholding the highest standards and values in everything they do. And what perfect occasion for the conferment of the awards than Homecoming? So, hurry now and submit the nominations at deanaa@hijli.iitkgp.ernet.in 
Kgp looks forward to be inspired by your passion and perseverance! :D

Students' Alumni Cell is all set to launch the next edition of it's initiative - Student Alumni Mentorship Programme with the aim to foster relationships between the students and the alumni and mend the broken link between them. We are pleased to announce that the alumni registrations for SAMP are now open! As an alumnus, you can share your personal and professional experiences with the current students and help open a mind to the world of opportunities outside of KGP. We invite all the alumni to be a part of SAMP and mentor their juniors by navigating to -  http://www.mentorship.iitkgp.ac.in/mentor_registration

Your contribution can make a difference in a student’s life!

The spring semester is a lot more fun and exciting than the Autumn Semester. It is also the time when graduating batch students gear up for their last months in the campus and also the Yearbook. Every year we try to make our Yearbook better and more engaging. For that purpose we have roped in 14 first years who will help us in making the Yearbook 2k18 even better than last year. Congratulations!! :D

Yearbook - A memoir of your indelible stay in KGP. Yes, it is here! With your active participation and involvement in the procedures of Students’ Alumni Cell it will become as personalized as it can get. Last year due to the overwhelming response in the portal the yearbook was a great success. 

This year we are back with even more amazing features and more amazing activities lined up for you. We look forward to your energetic, lively and spirited involvement in the same.

KGP ka Tempo high hai!!

#yearbook2k18

“There is nothing like returning to a place that remains unchanged to find the ways in which you yourself have altered.” – Nelson Mandela

KGP: The place that is home away from home, the place we’ve spent some of the best years of our life at, the place which will forever be special for everyone who's been here. Still drenched in nostalgia from the reunion of the golden jubilee, silver jubilee and ruby jubilee batches, KGP is gearing up to host the batches of 2003 and 2008 on 24th - 25th March 2018 for a trip down the memory lane, to relive the same old days with the people who become family during the course of stay here. 

KGP awaits your presence ❤️ 

Register Now!
http://alumni.iitkgp.ac.in/content/homecoming-2018

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur updated their cover photo.
message: The Students' Alumni Cell continuously endeavors to strengthen the relations of the alumni of this Institute and their alma mater. It has been instrumental in organising the Annual Alumni Meet, Regional Student Alumni Meet, regular guest lectures by distinguished alumni in the campus, publishing the annual literary magazine (Yearnings of Yore) & the annual yearbook. The Students' Alumni Cell also operates the Student - Alumni Mentorship Programme, My Imprint (Giving Back - Alumni contribution), recently launched Alumni Career Assistance Program and organises Phonathon, Alvida (the annual farewell dinner) and many more initiatives to be implemented in near future to bridge the gap between IIT Kharagpur and its esteemed alumni community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.
message: Recently all the Deans (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) of all IITs met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. It was a very fruitful discussion between the deans and the student representatives of the IITs. Alongside SPARC - Students' PAN IIT Alumni Relations Cell also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. The IITs present were IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Roorkee and IIT Kharagpur. Such meets are very necessary for all the IITs to be together and move forward as a community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.
message: Recently all the Deans (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) of all IITs met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. Alongside SPARC - Students' PAN IIT Alumni Relations Cell also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. message: Recently all the Deans (Alumni Affairs and International Relations) of all IITs met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. Alongside SPARC - Students' PAN IIT Alumni Relations Cell also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. The IITs present were IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Roorkee and IIT Kharagpur. Such meets are very necessary for all the IITs to be together and move forward as a community.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 8 new photos.
message: Recently all the Deans of 6 IITs of the Students’ Pan-IIT Alumni Relations Cell (SPARC) met at IIT Guwahati to discuss the encouragement of Startup culture in Academic Institutions. It was a very fruitful discussion between the deans and the student representatives of the IITs. Alongside SPARC also had productive meetings to discuss their future initiatives, which will be implemented in the coming few weeks. The IITs present were IIT Bombay, IIT Madras, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Roorkee and IIT Kharagpur. Such meets are very necessary for all the IITs to be together and move forward as a community.

I belong to the third batch of IIT (1953 entry) and was in the naval arch class '1958.  I have penned light hearted memories of the early days of the institute.  Please advise me how to share them with the Alumni community?

Captain Mohan Ram

We hope that the 15th Annual Alumni Meet was as enthralling an experience for you as it was for us! We enjoyed hosting you at your second home and we wish you have taken a bucket full of memories back with you to cherish. The smile on your faces was a priceless reward that we received in return to be etched into our hearts for eternity. The love and affection with which all of you interacted with us was a big take away for each one of us!

IIT Kharagpur is ready to fill the hearts of all alumni with nostalgia, rejoice, homecoming and celebration and illuminate the campus with their presence.

No celebration is complete without Dance and Music. Become a part of an awe-inspiring evening, free from all the daily hustle and bustle, to lose your mind and find your soul on 12th January from 5:30 P.M along with TDS, ETMS and WTMS at the 15th Annual Alumni Meet.

The 15th edition of the Annual Alumni Meet is fast approaching! Days fleet by but memories remain intact. With the preparations in full swing, IIT Kharagpur welcomes all alumni to reunite, rejoice, relive.

The hard work done by the Students' Alumni Cell is going to bear fruit as the 15th Annual Alumni Meet is just 4 days away. We prepare the Institute in full pomp and show to welcome the esteemed Alumni, giving them the best of the three days and making them feel home. The Annual Alumni Meet being the flagship event of the Students' Alumni Cell is going to be much grander this time and we believe will set a benchmark for the subsequent editions. Here comes the trailer for the 15th Annual Alumni Meet.

With just 7 days to the 15th Annual Alumni Meet, the Institute prepares itself with full enthusiasm to host its old leaves again, the alumni count minutes to their homecoming and the students brace themselves for the exhilaration of the Alumni Meet.

Yes, just the next week, same day, will witness the grand reunion and we just can't wait to color the campus with this amazing feeling.

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 2 new photos.
message: Over the years, Students' Alumni Cell has grown from an infant into what it is today. Prof Siddhartha Mukhopadhyay, as the Dean of Alumni Affairs an International relations has always been supportive and helped take the cell to new heights. He has now passed on the baton to Prof Baidurya Bhattacharya and the Students' Alumni Cell takes immense pleasure in welcoming him and looks forward to adding more feathers to the cap of Alumni Cell under his guidance.

Ambulance target reached! :D

Thanks once again to the tremendous generosity of our alumni, our ambulance target of $35,000 has been achieved!

Further money raised will go towards the student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services). Our goal is to reach $60,000.

A huge thanks to IITKGP Foundation for taking this initiative for the students.

Once again in tough times, the true spirit of KGP has emerged forth uniting the entire KGP family as a whole. 

#for_a_better_kgp
#every_help_counts

story: Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos.
message:
The Student-Alumni Meet, Hyderabad was conducted in full fervour on 23rd December. It observed an enthusiastic participation from the alumni and students alike. We would like to especially thank Hyderabad Chapter for their great support.
Stay connected with the page to know more about upcoming Student Alumni Meets and other programs.

Students' Alumni Cell wishes you a Merry Christmas and may this festival bring abundant joy and happiness in your life!
Students' Alumni Cell wishes you a Merry Christmas and may this festival bring abundant joy and happiness in your life!

If you get a chance to choose your life again, will you do it differently? What is your purpose in life? “Many Dreams Many Lives”, a book written by our alumna Ms Viji Narayanan (Batch of 1991) follows an Indian women in America who’s emotionally charged self journey begs us to ask these same question over and over again. Cultural discord, marriage, relationship issues with in-laws, world view from different societies, mental health everything is covered in this book. The book will be available on Amazon bookstore in all countries from 11th January 2018 as a paperback print and digital download from Kindle. 
Ms. Viji Narayanan graduated from the Architecture Department, IIT Kharagpur in 1991, is a software engineer and an emerging author with a love for a good story. She is also a  bollywood buff who aspires to make this unique and compelling book into a Bollywood movie one day.
Watch this Book trailer on Youtube to know more about “Many Dreams Many Lives” - https://youtu.be/UXyqPOtCHqE

Vacations and festivals have always been fun. To make this Winter Break more exciting and worthwhile, we bring to you the much anticipated Student Alumni Meet, Hyderabad edition. Employ the treasured counsel of our knowledgeable and experienced Alumni at SAM Hyderabad for which the student registrations are now open! Register yourself to be a part of fun and cognitive interaction with our Alumni based in Hyderabad.

Register now by navigating to https://tinyurl.com/sam-hyderabad-2017

Date : 23rd December
Time: 11 am to 3 pm 
Venue : Railway Officers' Club, Mettuguda

Days seem so slow and stagnant and we just can’t wait for the BIG days to knock on our doors, but when they finally arrive, they pass as if in a snap of our fingers everything we've been preparing for has already happened. The three days we have been waiting for, pass by as if in a flash, so fast that we can't believe our very eyes. So let us all savour the waiting and the craving. 
With just 25 days to go, we are all geared up to bring you the most enthralling 3 days of January. We are leaving no opportunity, to maximize this experience for you. Let's all take a Journey Back Home and unlock wonderful memories together!

PS- That's KGP from air around 30 years back! :D
